alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 7:18PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MONDAY MORNING NAVAJO NATION TIME... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Chinle and areas near Canyon De Chelly. * WHEN...Until Midnight Monday Morning Navajo Nation Time. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Chinle Wash is ongoing and structures are flooded. With warmer weather forecast this weekend, additional snowmelt is likely to keep flows in Chinle Wash elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 815 PM Navajo Nation Time, emergency management reported ongoing flooding across Chinle, especially at the mouth of Canyon De Chelly. Snowmelt is occurring and expected to continue. This will result in flooding of normally dry washes, creeks, and rivers. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chinle and Canyon De Chelly National Monument. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Keep children away from culverts, creeks and washes, especially near the mouth of Canyon De Chelly! Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away! Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away!
